newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 29.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 29.

text.p: All Mexican ports were reopened on Tuesday as a storm front dissipated in the Gulf of Mexico, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1500 local/2000 GMT daily meteorological report.
Crude shipping port Dos Bocas reopened at 1300 local/1800 GMT after being closed since Sunday at 2200 local/0300 GMT, a port official said.
Puerto Penasco port on the Pacific coast was reported closed to smaller tourism and fishing boats.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean.

Weak cold front along the northwest of the Baja California coast, moving slowly toward the southeast and drawing lower temperatures and possible rains. Winds from the north at 15 to 20 knots (28 to 38 km/16 to 22 miles per hour) with waves six to eight feet high.
Along the southern coastline winds less than 19 km/11 miles per hour with saves three to five feet high.

Disperse clouds along coast of southern Veracruz, Tabasco and Campeche states, with possible light rains. Winds from the east and southeast from 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 16 miles per hour) and waves three to five feet high.
Warmer temperatures and partly cloudy with winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
